STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
November 6, 2023
Cathey Prudhomme
EAGLE VILLAGE GERBER-PUTNAM
4991 165TH AVE,
HERSEY, MI, 49639-8776
Re: License #: CI670290163
Special Investigation #: 2023C0000795SI
Dear Mrs. Prudhomme:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager Jessica VandenHeuvel at (616) 204-6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Jennifer Pastorick, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
***This report contains sexually implicit information***
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
License #: CI670290163
Licensee Group Organization: Eagle Village Inc
Licensee Designee: Cathey Prudhomme
Chief Administrator: Cathey Prudhomme
Agency Name: EAGLE VILLAGE GERBER-PUTNAM
Agency Address: 4991 165TH AVE
HERSEY, MI 49639-8776
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 06/19/2025
Capacity: 10
II. METHODOLOGY

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program Statement.
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 9/18/2023, youth went into the bedroom of another youth and
sexually assaulted the youth.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
10/5/2023 in collaboration with law enforcement. Youth A
reported Youth B did not do anything to him. Youth A reported it
was all in his imagination. Youth A explained he sometimes thinks
things happen and he sees stuff that didn’t happen. Youth A
explained this happens due to his past trauma. Youth A reported
he told Staff 3 Youth B sexually abused him. Youth A reported
Youth B really did not sexually abuse him and it was his
imagination. Youth A reported he knew it was not real and it was
only in his imagination as Supervisor told him the video cameras
were reviewed and no youth ever went into Youth A’s bedroom.
Youth A reported he imagined the incident. When Youth A was
asked what he imagined, Youth A reported “normal things that
happen to people when they are sexually abused.” Youth A was
asked to explain what he meant and stated, “he put his front
2

privates in my butt, which did not happen.” Youth A reported he
told Staff 3 the same night that he imagined the incident occurring
around 12am which was approximately one hour after he
imagined the incident. Youth A reported he told Supervisor on
Sunday and Supervisor asked Youth A if the incident really
happened and if it did, Supervisor would believe him. Youth A told
Supervisor it did not really happen. Supervisor told Youth A video
camera footage was reviewed, and no youth went into Youth A’s
bedroom.
Youth B was interviewed via Teams meeting on 10/25/2023.
Youth B reported youth are not allowed to be alone with other
youth at the facility. Youth are always in staff’s line of sight unless
a youth goes absent without legal permission (AWOLP). Youth B
reported youth are not allowed in other youth’s bedrooms. Youth
B reported he was in Youth C’s bedroom once as a staff was
present and maintained line of sight the whole time. Youth B
reported he gets along with most of the youth that reside in
Putnam house with him. Youth B verbalized he does not like
Youth A as Youth A is “whinny” and explained Youth A complains
a lot about his family after phone calls. Youth B reported he has
never been in Youth A’s bedroom. Youth B denied ever having
any sexual relations with any of the youth at the facility. Youth B
reported he has never had any sexual interactions with Youth A.
Youth B has made statements to all the youth in the house
including Youth A that he will hit them when he has been angry.
Youth B reported no specific reason for threatening to hit peers in
the house including Youth A other than making threatening
statements when upset and that he is at the facility to work on his
anger. Youth B reported no knowledge of any youth at the facility
having a sexual relationship other than Youth A and Youth D (this
was investigated in special investigation 2023C0000396).
Staff 1 was interviewed via Teams meeting on 10/10/2023.
Staff 1 reported she works the night shift at Putnam house. Staff
1 worked 9/18/2023 to 9/19/2023. Staff 1 reported she was sitting
at the corner edge of the table where she can see down the
bedroom hallway. Staff 1 reported Youth A and Youth B were
asleep at 11pm on 9/18/2023. Staff 1 recalled this evening
specifically because she was in communication at 11pm with the
night supervisor regarding requesting some food items be brought
to the house. Staff 1 reported Youth C was the only youth that got
up to use the bathroom that night. Youth A and Youth B never got
up that night. Staff 1 reported she was concerned of interactions
between Youth A and Youth B on the night of 9/20/2023. Staff 1
reported she worked on 9/20/2023 from 10:45pm to 3am. Staff 1
3

arrived to work and was informed by Staff 2 how Youth B was
acting strange that evening and was very curious about what night
staff was coming in. After being informed of this, Staff 1 took
Youth B’s laundry downstairs and when she returned upstairs, she
was informed by Staff 2 that Youth A and Youth B were in the
kitchen whispering and Staff 2 sent them both back to their
bedrooms. Staff 2 told Staff 1 she thought Youth A and Youth B
were planning to go AWOL. Staff 1 went to Youth A’s bedroom to
see what was going on. Youth A wrote a note to Staff 1 saying he
could not tell her, and Youth B said he would hit him if he told.
Youth A told Staff 1 Youth B abuses him. Youth B then came out
of his bedroom saying the radio was too loud. Staff 1 found this
strange as the radio is on every night and Youth B normally does
not say anything about it. Youth B asked Staff 1 what she was
talking to Youth A about. Staff 1 reported she did not feel
comfortable with the feeling in the house that night. Youth A did
not tell Staff 1 how Youth B was abusing him. Youth A never
reported the abuse to be sexual to Staff 1. Staff 1 reported Staff 2
sat in the hallway all night to keep an eye on the youth. Staff 1
reported while she worked from 10:45pm-3:30am neither Youth A
nor Youth B came out of their bedrooms. Another staff came in to
relieve Staff 1 at 3am. Staff 1 reported the shift felt strange to her,
so she notified on call supervisor as well as emailed Supervisor
and Therapist about the situation. Staff 1 reported typically the
youth are asleep when she comes in for the night shift. Youth
occasionally get up to go to the bathroom or ask for a drink or
snack. Staff 1 reported when she completes checks at night, she
does varying interval checks not to exceed fifteen minutes and
checks on the youth with a flashlight to ensure they are in their
bedrooms sleeping. Staff 1 reported Youth A sometimes sleeps
with his bedroom door open or cracked. Staff 1 did not recall if
Youth A’s bedroom door was open or cracked on 9/18/2023 or
9/20/2023. Youth B always sleeps with his bedroom door open.
Staff 2 was interviewed via Teams meeting on 10/25/2023.
Staff 2 reported working the night shift on 9/20/2023 to the
morning of 9/21/2023. Staff 2 arrived to work around 10pm on
9/20/2023 and reported the youth in the house seemed to be “off”
meaning it felt abnormal to her. Youth A went into the kitchen to
get some water and Youth B followed him. Staff 2 observed
Youth B whispering to Youth A. Staff 2 sent both Youth A and
Youth B to their bedrooms. Staff 2 waited for Staff 1 to return
upstairs from being in the basement and told her she felt
something was going on. Staff 1 and Staff 2 went together to
Youth A’s bedroom to talk to Youth A. Staff 1 was talking to Youth
A and Youth B came out of his bedroom and wanted to know what
4

was going on. Staff 2 was focused on Youth B while Staff 1 talked
to Youth A. Youth A wrote a note saying Youth B would hit him if
he told. Staff 1 and Staff 2 both sent an email to Supervisor and
Therapist regarding concerns of the behavior in the house. Staff 2
reported she and Staff 1 kept a close eye on the youth the
remainder of the night. Staff 2 reported she has never seen Youth
B go into Youth A’s bedroom. Staff 2 completes night checks by
using a flashlight and going to the youth’s bedrooms and looking
in the bedrooms to ensure youth are in their bedrooms and safe.
Staff 2 sits outside the staff office or at the end of the dining room
table at night to have a direct line of sight down the bedroom
hallway. Staff 2 reported she has not spoken directly to Youth A
regarding the allegations. Youth A did not report any information
to her that he was sexually abused by Youth B. Youth A and
Youth B continue to be on a safety plan and believes the youth
should continue the safety plan.
Staff 3 was interviewed via Teams meeting on 10/25/2023.
Staff 3 reported he was working on 9/26/2023 and Youth A came
to him and told him he had been sexually abused by Youth B on
9/18/2023. Staff 3 took Youth A to the staff office to talk to him.
Youth A wrote on a piece of paper what happened and gave the
paper to Staff 3. Staff 3 reported Youth A wrote Youth B went into
his bedroom and sexually assaulted him by having anal
intercourse. Staff 3 left Youth A’s written statement on the staff
desk for Therapist. Staff 3 noted the day Youth A told him about
the allegations, Youth B was acting “odd”. Staff 3 described this as
Youth B asking a lot of questions, wanting to know what Youth A
was talking to Staff 3 about. Staff 3 reported Youth B started
acting out in his bedroom which is not normal behavior for Youth
B. Staff 3 reported he was not working on 9/18/2023. Staff 3
worked on 9/20/2023 and he did not have any concerns on his
shift. Staff 3 did not recall when, but stated he was informed at
some point Staff 1 and Staff 2 had concerns about the dynamics
in the house feeling off and concerns with interaction in the
kitchen between Youth A and Youth B. Staff 3 reported he has
never seen Youth B go into Youth A’s bedroom or any other
youth’s bedroom. Staff 3 reported Youth B had been asking a lot
of questions prior to 9/26/2023 about what night staff were
working and found this to be odd behavior. Staff 3 reported he
has not noticed any changes in the dynamics or relationship
between Youth A and Youth B. Youth A and Youth B
communicate with one another however don’t interact much
together. Staff 3 reported Youth A and Youth B are on a safety
plan to be closely monitored and he feels the safety plan should
continue. Staff 3 reported he does not work overnight shifts.
5

Supervisor was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
10/5/2023. Supervisor reported Youth A alleged the incident
occurred on 9/18/2023. Youth A approached Supervisor and
asked Supervisor if he had heard what happened to him.
Supervisor did not discuss the allegations with Youth A in detail.
Supervisor had a second conversation with Youth A regarding the
incident the following Sunday 9/29/2023 at the house. Youth A
approached Supervisor and asked to talk with him in the office.
Youth A asked Supervisor if Supervisor would be mad at Youth A
if Youth A told the truth. Youth A told Supervisor that the incident
between he and Youth B did not happen. Youth A then disclosed
to Supervisor that he is hearing voices and seeing people.
Supervisor reported he completed an incident report on this
conversation. Supervisor reported there was an incident he was
informed about regarding concerns between Youth A and Youth B
from overnight staff. Supervisor reported there is a case note and
an email was sent to Therapist about the situation. Supervisor
reported he never told Youth A that he watched video, and no
youth were seen going into Youth A’s bedroom. Supervisor told
Youth A from what staff have seen, there were no youth viewed
going into Youth A’s bedroom.
Therapist was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
10/5/2023. Therapist reported she received an email from Staff 1
and Staff 2 regarding an incident that happened with Youth A and
Youth B. Therapist did not recall the date, but there were
concerns about Youth A and Youth B whispering. Staff 1 and
Staff 2 heard whispering and went to investigate the situation.
Therapist talked to Youth A on 9/28/2023 and Youth A reported
Youth B sexually assaulted him. Therapist reported Youth A
thought he was coming to talk to her about a home pass however
when Therapist asked about what occurred Youth A’s body
language changed, and Youth A got a quiet voice and would not
make eye contact with her. Therapist is also Youth B’s therapist
however she has not spoken with Youth B regarding the
allegations. Therapist reported there have been no concerns with
Youth B having any sexual interactions with any youth at the
facility. Therapist reported Youth A has made previous allegations
about other youth at the facility since he has been there regarding
sexual abuse and there have not been any findings to his prior
allegations at this facility. Therapist reported Youth A was
previously sexually abused while in placement at another facility.
Therapist reported Youth A has disclosed that he is hearing voices
and seeing things, and this is being addressed in his psychiatric
appointments.
6

Administrator/Complainant was interviewed via telephone on
9/29/2023 and face-to-face at the facility on 10/5/2023.
Administrator reported video camera footage has been reviewed
from the night of 9/18/2023 to 9/19/2023 and only one youth exits
their bedroom and goes to the bathroom and then back to his
bedroom. No youth ever enter Youth A’s bedroom per reviewing
the video camera footage. A safety plan has been put into place
for Youth A and Youth B. Administrator reported upon looking into
the reported incident it was found varying interval checks not to
exceed fifteen minutes were not completed as required.
Foster Care Worker was interviewed via telephone on
10/2/2023. Foster Care Worker reported Youth B does not have
any history of sexual abuse.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of 9/18/2023 in Putnam bedroom hall was reviewed
on 10/5/2023.
9/18/2023 video footage from 9pm through 9/19/2023 at 6am was
viewed. Youth A comes out of his bedroom at 9:30pm and walks
to the living room, then to the bathroom, and back to his bedroom.
Youth C comes out of his bedroom at 2:05am and goes to the
bathroom and then back to his bedroom. Youth B is never seen
leaving his bedroom. No youth enters Youth A’s bedroom.
Video footage from 9/20/2023-9/21/2023 was attempted to be
viewed on 10/25/2023 however the video was no longer able to be
viewed as the video footage only lasts thirty days.
Documents Reviewed:
• Eagle Village Residential Services Standard Operating
Procedures Supervision of Residents Policy: The staff
responsible for supervision of the youth during the sleeping
hours in the house is responsible for ensuring that all youth
are accounted for. This requires up-night staff to do regular
room checks to physically verify that all youth are in the
house and in bed.
• Eagle Village Case Note Report for Youth A dated
9/26/2023 at 6:00pm: Youth A informed Staff 3 he was
being sexually abused by Youth B. Youth A reported the
sexual abuse happened on Monday 9/18/2023 at 11pm.
Youth A reported Youth B entered his room at night and
sexually abused him. Youth A did not provide any further
details.
7

• Eagle Village Case Note dated 9/29/2023 at 8:00pm: Youth
A told Supervisor the allegations he made against Youth B
were false and he made the allegations against Youth B
due to being upset with Youth B. Youth A reported he
hears voices and sees people sometimes and Youth A
reported he saw Youth B in his room doing stuff to him that
really did not occur.
• Email exchange from Staff 1 to Supervisor and Therapist
dated 9/21/2023: Staff 2 overheard Youth A and Youth B
having a conversation however could not hear what was
being said. Staff 1 spoke with Youth A who stated he was
told not to tell staff that Youth B was abusive toward him.
Youth A wrote a note to Staff 1 saying Youth B “would hit
me if I told”. Youth B started acting strange through the
night and walked down to Youth A’s bedroom to see what
Staff 1 and Youth A were talking about. Staff 1 reported
she had noticed manipulation and verbal abuse from Youth
B to other youth.
• Email dated 9/21/2023 from Staff 2 to Therapist stating as
Staff 1 said, there were some issues Wednesday night in
Putnam house.
• Youth A Safety Plan dated 9/26/2023: Youth A is on a
safety plan due to allegations of sexual abuse by Youth B.
Youth A’s bedroom door is to remain open at all times,
Youth A is to remain is staff’s eyesight and close proximity
during waking hours, Youth A is to have close observation
and varying observation checks every ten minutes, Youth A
will be accompanied by staff to the bathroom and checked
on every two minutes, staff are to be present in the
hallways with direct supervision on Youth A’s bedroom door
when Youth A is in his bedroom.
• Youth B Safety Plan dated 9/26/2023: Youth B is on a
safety plan due to sexual abuse allegations being made
against him. Youth B’s bedroom door is to remain open at
all times, Youth B is to remain is staff’s eyesight and close
proximity during waking hours, Youth B is to have close
observation and varying observation checks every ten
minutes, Youth B will be accompanied by staff to the
bathroom and checked on every two minutes, staff are to
be present in the hallways with direct supervision on Youth
B’s bedroom door when Youth B is in his bedroom.
• Eagle Village Putnam House Head Count and Building
Check Sheet dated 9/18/2023 through 9/19/2023: Varying
8

interval checks not to exceed fifteen minutes were
completed by Staff 1 from 10:03pm to 6:00am and indicate
all youth were sleeping throughout the night.
• Eagle Village Putnam House Head Count and Building
Check Sheet dated 9/20/2023 through 9/21/2023: Varying
interval checks not to exceed fifteen minutes were
completed from 8:00pm to 7am. All youth were indicated as
sleeping through the night expect one youth that was
unidentified being up at 10:51pm, Youth C using the
bathroom at 4:43am, and Youth A using the bathroom at
6:30am.
• Meceola Consolidated Central Dispatch Command Log Call
time 9/27/2023: Youth on youth sexual assault allegations.
• Written statement from Youth A.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as they provided supervision.
Video footage of 9/18/2023 to 9/19/2023 was reviewed and no
youth are seen going into Youth A’s bedroom. Youth A and Youth
B are on safety plans and will continue to be on safety plans at
this time.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4127 Staff to resident ratio.
Section (4) When residents are asleep or otherwise outside of the direct
Description supervision of staff, staff shall perform variable interval, eye-on
checks of residents. The time between the variable interval checks
shall not exceed fifteen minutes.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation On the night of 9/18/2023 a night check on the youth exceeded
the fifteen minutes.
Investigation Interviews:
Staff 1 was interviewed via Teams meeting on 10/10/2023.
Staff 1 reported when she completes checks at night, she does
varying interval checks not to exceed fifteen minutes and checks
on the youth with a flashlight to ensure they are in their bedrooms
sleeping.
Administrator/Complainant was interviewed via telephone on
9/29/2023, face-to-face at the facility on 10/5/2023, and via
Teams meeting on 10/25/2023. Administrator reported while
reviewing the video footage on the night of 9/18/2023 to 9/19/2023
it was found there were no checks completed on youth from
11:52pm until 12:20am. Administrator reported upon reviewing
the head count sheet, it was indicated a check occurred at
9

12:04am which did not occur per the video. Administrator noted
the video times compared to the head count sheet are a minute or
two off which could be a result of staff using the microwave clock
time when documenting checks.
Documentation Reviewed:
• Eagle Village Putnam House Head Count and Building
Check Sheet dated 9/18/2023 through 9/19/2023: Varying
interval checks not to exceed fifteen minutes were
completed by Staff 1 from 10:03pm to 6:00am and indicate
all youth were sleeping throughout the night.
• Eagle Village Residential Services Standard Operating
Procedures Supervision of Residents Policy: staff member
is to complete room checks, which must be done at irregular
intervals, never to exceed 15 minutes apart.
• Staff 1’s personnel file: Staff 1 received verbal discipline on
5/25/2023 for falling asleep on an overnight shift. Staff 1
received up night responsibilities training on 9/28/2021 and
10/5/2021, and supervision training on 9/22/2022.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage from 9/18/2023-9/19/2023 was attempted to be
viewed on 10/25/2023 to verify the varying interval checks not to
exceed fifteen minutes however the video was no longer able to
be viewed as the video footage only lasts thirty days.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance for completing variable
interval checks not to exceed fifteen minutes per interview with
Administrator.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code & PA 116 722.120 Investigation and examination of conditions,
Section books, records, and reports; visits regarding health or fire
Description protection; records; report; forms; confidentiality; disclosure of
information; availability of confidential records.
(c) Providing accurate and truthful information to the department,
and encouraging witnesses, such as staff and household
members, to provide accurate and truthful information to the
department.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Falsification of Head Count and Building Check Sheet dated
9/18/2023 through 9/19/2023.
Investigation Interview:
Administrator/Complainant was interviewed via telephone on
9/29/2023, face-to-face at the facility on 10/5/2023, and via
Teams meeting on 10/25/2023. Administrator reported while
10

reviewing the video footage on the night of 9/18/2023 to 9/19/2023
it was found Staff 1 did not complete checks on youth from
11:52pm until 12:20am. Administrator reported upon reviewing
the head count sheet, Staff 1 indicated a check occurred at
12:04am which did not occur per the video.
Documentation Reviewed:
• Eagle Village Putnam House Head Count and Building
Check Sheet dated 9/18/2023 through 9/19/2023: Varying
interval checks not to exceed fifteen minutes were
completed by Staff 1 from 10:03pm to 6:00am and indicate
all youth were sleeping throughout the night.
• Eagle Village Residential Services Standard Operating
Procedures Supervision of Residents Policy: staff member
is to complete room checks, which must be done at irregular
intervals, never to exceed 15 minutes apart.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as Staff 1 documented
completing a check on youth at 12:04am on the head count and
building check sheet when she had not per the video footage
reviewed by Administrator.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
It is recommended upon receipt of an acceptable corrective no change be
made to the license status of this child caring institution.
10/30/2023
